best_practices: Use separate Git repositories or branches for different environments
Enable automated sync only for development and staging environments
Implement health checks for custom resources to ensure proper deployment status
Use External Secrets or Sealed Secrets to keep sensitive data out of Git
anti_patterns: Storing plain text secrets in Git repositories
Using automated sync for production without approval gates
Mixing infrastructure and application code in the same repository
Skipping health checks and sync status monitoring

faq.question: Which GitOps tool should I choose - ArgoCD or Flux?
faq.answer: ArgoCD has a rich UI and is easier for beginners. Flux is more lightweight and integrates well with GitHub. Both follow the same GitOps principles.

faq.question: Can I use this with private Git repositories?
faq.answer: Yes, both ArgoCD and Flux support private repositories through SSH keys or access tokens. Configure credentials during setup.

faq.question: How do I handle secrets in GitOps?
faq.answer: Use External Secrets Operator to pull from secret managers, or Sealed Secrets to encrypt secrets before committing to Git.

faq.question: What happens if the Git repository is unavailable?
faq.answer: GitOps tools cache the last known state. Applications continue running, but new changes cannot be deployed until Git is accessible.

faq.question: Can I rollback deployments?
faq.answer: Yes, by reverting to a previous Git commit. GitOps tools will automatically sync the cluster to match the desired state in Git.

faq.question: How do I monitor sync status?
faq.answer: Use ArgoCD UI or Flux CLI commands. Set up Prometheus alerts for sync failures and configure notifications to Slack or email.
